Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that Sheikh Mohammed did not make the alleged comments about his great-grandson riding a camel in the BBC interview.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks enough support as there is no evidence or proof provided to support the alleged comments made by Sheikh Mohammed.
Exist alternative explanation: There is an alternative explanation for the alleged quotes, as they appear to be an amalgamation of the words of an author and a former ruler of Dubai.
Exaggerate: The claim exaggerates the statements made by Sheikh Mohammed, as he did not mention anything about his great-grandson riding a camel in the interview.
Understate: There is no evidence of the claim understating any information.
Falters at times: The claim falters at times by misrepresenting the statements made by Sheikh Mohammed in the BBC interview.
Problematic assumption: The claim makes a problematic assumption that Sheikh Mohammed made the alleged comments without providing any credible evidence.
